name: MistralAIModel

input.content:
I have a webpage that's open in a chrome browser but the page no longer exists. 
What javascript should I type in the console to get a copy of the entire page html?

output:
You can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console to get a copy of the entire page HTML:

```javascript
console.log(document.documentElement.outerHTML);
```

This code logs the outerHTML of the entire document, effectively giving you a copy of the entire page HTML. After running this command, you can right-click on the logged output in the console and click "Store as global variable" (usually labeled as `temp1`) to save it as a variable for further usage. Then, you can right-click on the variable and select "Copy value" to copy the HTML to your clipboard.

name: WordEvaluator
input:
You can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console to get a copy of the entire page HTML:

```javascript
console.log(document.documentElement.outerHTML);
```

This code logs the outerHTML of the entire document, effectively giving you a copy of the entire page HTML. After running this command, you can right-click on the logged output in the console and click "Store as global variable" (usually labeled as `temp1`) to save it as a variable for further usage. Then, you can right-click on the variable and select "Copy value" to copy the HTML to your clipboard.
